results.title: Dernier Carat
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
In order to save her name and Stephane’s, Olympe negotiates the return of the jewels against immunity from prosecution. Boudot organises a television link-up between Paris and Montreal to close the investigation.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: C'est Parti!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Stephane receives orders from Morales to substitute the jewels back on arrival in Montreal. To convince him to obey orders, Morales reminds him that Olympe is now a de facto accomplice since she is the one who cleared the jewels through customs. In Paris, Bicou and Jacinthe are in possession of a necklace without knowing that it is part of the treasure. Lulu is trying is hardest to recover them from the children.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: C'est Jeudi, Jacinthe!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Lulu and Stephane have managed to swap the last jewels in Olympe’s (the star of the ballet) dressing room. When she arrives at 8 am to pick up her luggage before going to the airport, she discovers the night watchman tied up in the shower. She immediately sounds the alert. Meanwhile, Lulu and Stephane are still trying to find a way out of the Opera House. When they do so, they bump into Jacinthe who recognises the bag from the previous night.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

group_works.title: L'age d'or des Provinces Unies = The golden age of the United Provinces
La guerre de cent ans = The hundred year war
La Revolution Francaise = the French Revolution
Le grand siecle de Louis XIV = The great reign of Louis XIV
Le printemps des peuples = The awakening of the people
Le Siecle des Lumieres = the Age of Reason
Les Annees Folles = the Crazy Years
Pierre le Grand et son epoque = Pierre the Great and his times

results.title: Pierre le Grand et son epoque = Pierre the Great and his times
results.brief_description:
Episode 19 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
Peter the Great, czar of Russia (1672-1725) was one of this country’s greatest statesmen, organisers, and reformers. Major events of his reign are covered in this episode, including the war against Sweden, the construction of St Petersburg and Peter’s various attempts at modernising the country and opening it to Western ideas.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Pax Romana
results.brief_description:
Episode 7 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
In 52 BC, Julius Cesar defeats Vercingetorix and conquers Gaul. Soon the Pax Romana will expand to all of Europe and the British Isles. This episode presents an overview of Roman civilisation with a particular focus on civil and military engineering.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Once Upon a Time ...
results.brief_description:
Episode 26 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
Man has always been bad at planning. This episode takes us forward in time to show us the potentially fatal consequence of our inability or illwill to care for the environement and consider ecologically sustainable responses to developement. Topics include: recycling, crisis for resources, nuclear destruction and space exploration.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: L’Amerique
results.brief_description:
Episode 21 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
This episode gives a very broad summary of the history of the North American continent, from the time of the arrival of the Mayflower in 1620 to the gold rush of 1849. It also covers the colonisation of Canada and the Anglo-French war.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Les Voyages de Marco Polo
results.brief_description:
Episode 12 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
This episode covers the expansion of the Mongol Empire with Gengis Khan and then his grand son, Kublai Khan. Niccolo and Maffeo Polo, two Venitian merchants reach the court of the Great Khan. When they return to Europe as Kublai’s ambassadors to the pope, they are charged with letters asking the pope to send Kublai one hundred intelligent men ‘acquainted with the Seven Arts’. They are asked to bring back some oil from the lamp burning at the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem. On their second journey, they take along their nephew Marco who was to stay at the Khan’s court for 20 years and recount his adventure in a book ‘Il Milione’.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Les Premiers Empires
results.brief_description:
Episode 5 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
Hammourabi, king of Babylon writes the first legal code. In this world made of rival cities, visionary rulers push and battle to built vast empires. This episode follows Darius, king of Persia and his many battles to expand his empire eastward to encompass Greece and Athens. It also recounts the formidable epic of Alexander the Great who succeeded in uniting Greece and Persia under his command.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].
